security: Disclosing the identities and positions of Cuban officials could compromise them and hinder ongoing or future intelligence operations. Directly quoting: 'IDENTITY A (ISIDRO CONTRERAS) COMMANDING OFFICER OF PINAR DEL RIO NAVAL DISTRICT... IDENTITY BFNU (IGNARRA MATARRAN) COMMANDING OFFICER OF EASTERN SOUGE DISTRICT (ORIENTE).'
summary: A CIA message identifies several Cuban officials, detailing their positions, backgrounds, and affiliations within the Cuban military, police, and government.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET message, dated October 30, 1963, relays information regarding the identities and positions of various Cuban officials. These individuals include Isidro Contreras, Commanding Officer of the Pinar del Rio Naval District; Ignarra Matarran, Commanding Officer of the Eastern Souge District; Jose Ponce, former commander taking a guided missile course in the US; and numerous others holding positions in the Cuban army, navy, police, and government. The message provides details about their backgrounds, such as participation in the Moncada attack, the Gramma landing, and service during the Batista regime.
title: Identities of Cuban Officials
